top_comment.text:
I hate this so much about my own culture (and I generally love my culture. 
But I hate that TYT even made this video. I hate that it was in the NYT, I 
hate that I saw this covered on Fox News and MSNBC. I just absolutely hate 
that since Kennedy we have this constant "Real World DC, big politics 
edition" around our presidents. Say Clinton you think Lewinsky. Say Spitzer 
you think client #9. It makes us, Americans, look so shallow; and quite 
frankly it makes us look stupid. I would bet, like actually throw 
significant money down, that more people know about the past 5 president's 
spouses, families, scandals, and exploits than they do about their policies 
(beyond just democrat/republican). Why do we care? Why do we care if 
Barrack and Michelle aren't getting along today? Why do we care if he 
smokes? Why should we even care if he screws Miss NY, Miss NJ, and Mr. PA?

A scholar's measured by his knowledge, a surgeon's measured by how many 
lives he's saved, a quarterback's measured by how many INTs he throws (Eli 
Manning sucks), but a politician's measured by some ambiguous tabloid 
definition of character? We treat our leaders like they're in boybands, and 
I hate it. I absolutely hate it.

I just hate that shit.

I really do.﻿

comments.text:
Hey, it's not a "funeral" full of sad people, it was a MEMORIAL CELEBRATION 
of Mandela's life. All the citizens were laughing, dancing, singing, etc.!! 
It's not like it was Paul Walker, who died, suddenly, out of nowhere in a 
violent & tragic auto accident; it's Mandela - he lived a long life, did 
great things, died naturally & peacefully. Funerals & memorials should be 
celebrated, mourned, paid respect, etc. depending on how the person died, 
who they were, & what they would want. There's no one "rule", & even within 
cultures, the diversity of rituals are immense.

top_comment.text:
Wait a minute. Am I the only one who is mad at Obama cause he took a selfie 
at a funeral of a legend. He was there representing USA as a head of a 
state. The issue is not Michele Obamas reaction or Danish blonde Prime 
Minister. The issue is you are at a funeral of a Legend. If you do not have 
that decorum then you are not fit to be a Head of the state. I do not care 
what Obama does in his private life for all I know he can invite the Danish 
PM for a swingers party at his home and make a porno about and I wouldn't 
care. I care for what he does in his office in his position of Head of a 
State and this was one of the occasion where he disappointed me.﻿

comments.text:

Conservatives MUST make a big deal out of anything they can. They continue

comments.text:
+Diana Peña "The people who already had insurance were merely switched to 
another plan" No they weren't. Show proof. 

"Utter Chaos: White House Exempts Millions From Obamacare's Insurance 
Mandate" - Forbes

Many of the people who lost their policies are getting exempted, shitty 
catastrophic coverage only. You took their plans, left them out in the cold

Wait till next years employer mandate kicks in
comments.author: TheRetiredtrucker

comments.text:
+TheRetiredtrucker
Yes, uninsured people who signed up and are now insured. The people who 
already had insurance were merely switched to another plan, technically 
having their old ones cancelled. They're still covered. Heck, my mom got a 
"cancellation" letter, but still has insurance. The plans merely switched. 
That's how it works. You get your old plan cancelled for one with ACA 
standards. -_-
comments.author: Diana Peña

comments.author: Plato86

comments.text:
Or maybe because Republicans have nothing to gain from needless attacks on

incident has anything to do with Obama's race, if the US currently had a

would still be reacting as they are now. You telling me if Bill Clinton was 
currently president and in this situation, conservatives would be doing
